cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: [...] x bar#? kankal ki dab5?-ba-gin7 PAP? NE? nu-mu-x
x ⸢ka⸣-giri3-a? giri3-us2-sa-gin7 du-lumx(MURGU2) ba-an-DU?-DU#?
e2?-garx(MURGU2) ša3 sur3?-za zi ⸢šub⸣-zu du3-du3-a-gin7 ur2#?-gu10 ba-da-zal?
anše-edin-na DA ŠEŠ x x aga-kar2 ba-an-si-ge
ur-mah ub4 nig2-huš šub-ba x [...] x TAR#? ERIM#? DU? nu-tuku
en-nu-ug3 en-<nu>-ug3 nu-me-a nam-uš2-ta? sa2#?-a
u2 nu-nu2-nu2 nig2-gig-ga ša3-gu10-uš? ba-an-ku4-a#? ša3 hul ba-an-sur-re-en
nam-kal mu2-a du10-ga-gu10 gu7-e ib2? ir? da ba-RI?
x x u3-tu-da x-gu10 an-gin7 mu-⸢da⸣-su13 ki-x-AŠ mu-da-ku4
[...] x DI-DI x HI ŠEŠ ba-la2-la2 ba KAM IL2?
UD#? x x nam-tag nu-zu-gu10 sag x a#? ba-su13-u4-de3#?
buru5 e-ne-še3 mi-⸢ni⸣-in-ur4-ur4 muš3-zu nu-pa3-de3
ša3 ib2-ba ša3 gur-ru PA-du3 in-x-x-ba?
gaba gur-ru ša3-⸢la⸣ su13 gi4 gur-ru šu dab5-ba za-kam
... threshing floor/uncultivated land, like seized land(?) ...
The ... of the path(?), like the track, brings(?) toil
Like a wall built for your rescue in the midst of your ditch(?), my base/lap(?) disintegrated(?)
The “donkey of the plain” (onager) ... will smite ...
A lion that fell into a pitfall ... does not have ...
A guard who is not on guard(?) is comparable with death(?)
(I?) will not lie down in the grass (so that!?) something bad could enter my stomach, (because) I will have terrible diarrhea
Eating(?) my strong-growing, sweet tasting (crops?) ...
... born, my ... which is distant(?) like heaven(?), I(?) enter into(?).../... alone(?)
... my blameless ... is far away/profound/undulating(?)
Birds have gathered up towards him, he cannot see your face(?)
An angry heart ... a relenting heart
"Turning the chest” (for?) compassion, returning, turning, “seizing"(?), it is yours
